conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D and pass through baffles to reach containers E, F, or G.
Liquid A originates from the top left corner.
Liquid B originates from the top center.
Liquid C originates from the top right corner.
Liquid D originates from the top far right.

premise: Liquid A flows downward and to the right due to the blue baffle below it.
conclusion: Liquid A continues straight and flows into container E.

premise: Liquid B flows downward and to the right but is stopped by the green baffle below it.
conclusion: Liquid B turns left and flows into container F.

premise: Liquid C flows downward and to the right but is stopped by the red baffle above it.
conclusion: Liquid C turns left and flows into container G.

premise: Liquid D flows downward and to the right but is intercepted by the orange baffle above it.
conclusion: Liquid D turns left and flows into container E.

premise: Streams A, B, and C strike the blue slanted barrier and are deflected to the left. Stream D hits the grey slanted barrier and is deflected to the right.
conclusion: Streams A, B, and C mix up and hug the left wall and flow straight down, while stream D hugs the right wall and flows straight down.

premise: Streams A, B, and C mix up and hug the left wall and flow straight down.
conclusion: Most of the mixture of A, B, and C ends in container E.

premise: Stream C splits another thin branch and strikes the black baffle.
conclusion: The thin stream of C ends in container F.

premise: Stream D hugs the right wall and flows straight down.
conclusion: Stream D ends in container G.

premise: Most of the mixture of A, B, and C ends in container E; the thin stream of C ends in container F; stream D ends in container G.
conclusion: Container E receives liquids A, B, and C; container F receives a thin stream of C; container G receives liquid D.
